title: How to Discharge a CRT Monitor

steps.title: Leave it alone for a few hours.
steps.content: Leave it alone for a few hours. If you can afford to waste a lot of time, twenty-four hours would be better.

steps.title: Wear rubber-soled shoes (no steel toes) and safety goggles.
steps.content: Wear rubber-soled shoes (no steel toes) and safety goggles. Take off all your jewelry, especially rings and watches. You don't want to be grounded in any way.

steps.title: Find a heavy flat-bladed screwdriver with good insulation.
steps.content: Find a heavy flat-bladed screwdriver with good insulation. A Swiss Army knife is not acceptable.

steps.title: Find a heavy-gauge wire with alligator clips on the end.
steps.content: Find a heavy-gauge wire with alligator clips on the end.

steps.title: Take the monitor's case off -- and don't forget where the screws go in.
steps.content: Take the monitor's case off -- and don't forget where the screws go in. This could lead to embarrassment.

steps.title: Attach one alligator clamp to an unpainted portion of the metal frame.
steps.content: Attach one alligator clamp to an unpainted portion of the metal frame.

steps.title: Attach the other alligator clip to the screwdriver's metal shaft.
steps.content: Attach the other alligator clip to the screwdriver's metal shaft.

steps.title: Make sure that neither you or the screwdriver are in contact with anything metal.
steps.content: Make sure that neither you or the screwdriver are in contact with anything metal.

steps.title: The anode is a wire covered by a suction cup.
steps.content: The anode is a wire covered by a suction cup. Slide the screwdriver blade under the suction cup until you hear a loud pop and see a blue flash.

steps.title: Wait for about 30 minutes and repeat.
steps.content: Wait for about 30 minutes and repeat.
